subject: libsmack: fix parsing of CIPSO settings
commitMessage:
libsmack: fix parsing of CIPSO settings

Adjust CIPSO parsing to expected kernel format:
- maximum number of categories is 184
- each category value must be between 1 and 184

To decrease size of struct cipso_mapping, categories are now stored in a
bit array. Thanks to this, category bitmap occupies 96 bits instead of 736.

Change-Id: I38b8fa5bd0830abc59de9dc3ebf208e18a82bbeb
Signed-off-by: Rafal Krypa <r.krypa@samsung.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Build Successful

Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+1

It looks good to me, I verified this on emulator.
One thing that I noticed is that if cipso was in format:
#cat /etc/smack/cipso.d/ala3.cipso myownlabel 2 0 1 2 3 4

it was ok before and now causes
#smackcipso /etc/smack/cipso.d
Reading from '/etc/smack/cipso.d' failed.

It was not failing to the time, but is now. This 0 in category set has no sense, it was ommited to the time. Now it causes error, so all other numbers are not loaded to kernel...

All in all it is up to you to decide.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

Patch Set 1: Reverted

This patchset was reverted in change: I15dc6a88a3721af2798ef85b837cdc51a0a1e94a

subject: libsmack: fix smack_have_access() (regression in d7319c71)
commitMessage:
libsmack: fix smack_have_access() (regression in d7319c71)

Commit d7319c71 introduced an internal function for opening smackfs files,
when there is a long and short label version. The new function always
opens the file write only, but smack_have access() requires O_RDWR.
The internal function is now extended to take argument with file access
mode.

Change-Id: Ibf3d55cbcbbf746f95660d2f630ef0bfe719026c
Signed-off-by: Rafal Krypa <r.krypa@samsung.com>

subject: libsmack: add functions for getting and setting labels from files.
commitMessage:
libsmack: add functions for getting and setting labels from files.

Functions smack_getlabel(), smack_lgetlabel() and smack_fgetlabel()
provide an interface for reading SMACK labels from extended attributes
of files and file descriptors. Functions smack_setlabel(),
smack_lsetlabel() and smack_fsetlabel() can be used to set the labels.

subject: Support the "l" option in libsmack
commitMessage:
Support the "l" option in libsmack

The "l" access mode was added to the Linux 3.12 kernel.
This adds potentially non-backward-compatable support to
libsmack for Tizen 3. This patch should be replaced by
the upstream version when it is available.

Change-Id: I710399f5e63b7a6afc8915876a653fe1219ab0bd
Signed-off-by: Casey Schaufler <casey.schaufler@intel.com>

 arm            i586

I have tested this with tizen_20131202.9_ivi-mbr-i586-sdb images.

subject: Remove obsolete systemd smack.service and smack.mount
commitMessage:
Remove obsolete systemd smack.service and smack.mount

Loading smack rules and mounting smackfs are now handled
within systemd. These "services" are no longer required.

Change-Id: I4df33603d69df3532519875db04ef25a96b02c24
Signed-off-by: Casey Schaufler <casey.schaufler@intel.com>
